intro: Mertensia praecox, commonly known as early bluebells, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its striking clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white down. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its medicinal and ornamental plants. Mertensia praecox plays an important ecological role by providing early nectar sources for pollinators.
